item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeTammy Bellofatto shared a post to the group: Taskforce Denver Homeless.Cuícatl Montoya

Hello friends and members of the Denver community, next week will be a great opportunity to learn more about what safe outdoor spaces are, the benefits to the community and most importantly the benefits for the people being served.

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeDenver Homeless Out LoudSweeps Scheduled for Tuesday (9/29) and Wednesday (9/30): When will this Move along...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeDenver Homeless Out Loud

Sweeps Scheduled for Tuesday (9/29) and Wednesday (9/30): When will this Move along To NOWHERE End…

There are two more sites where people without housing live t...hat are slated to be swept next week. 21st and Market/Blake is currently home to about 60 people without housing - some of whom have been living for months, some who moved there recently from the 22nd st sweep or the 25th st sweep. This site was posted for a sweep the same day as residents from 25th and Arapahoe moved to this site in search of anywhere to be. 25th and Welton is currently home to another 60 or so people without housing. Most of the residents on the right of way strip on 25th have been living there for many months. Others living in the parking lot area have moved there recently after other sweeps.

Residents of these encampments all ask the same question: where are we supposed to go?? The City has done nothing to get these people access to housing. They are not even being offered hotel rooms through the COVID FEMA funding. They are being told to either go to a shelter or go to jail.

Come support residents of these encampments as they demand real housing or places where they are allowed to survive.

Bring the following things to assist residents:

-Truck, or any vehicle to help move

-Carts

-Bungee Cords/Rope

-Trash Bags

-Food

-Coffee/CoCo

-Water

Your assistance is much appreciated! Somewhere around 7am and all morning help will likely be needed.

Toward Rights, Dignity and Housing…

See More
item.author: North Denver for Social Justice

Denver clears path for zoning change that could free up land for managed homeless campsites

The Denver City Council is considering a temporary zoning amendment that would liberate land restricted under “old” zoning code for emergency uses, such as city-sanctioned homeless encampments and outdoor expansionsThe Denver City Council is considering a temporary zoning amendment that would liberate land restricted under “old” zoning code for emergency uses, such as city-sanctioned homeless encampments and outdoor expansions

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeDenver Homeless Out LoudResidents of Encampment at 25th and Arapahoe make Three Demands of the City Before...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeDenver Homeless Out Loud

Residents of Encampment at 25th and Arapahoe make Three Demands of the City Before Sweep Set for Tuesday

Moving Support Needed On Tuesday: Please Come (see deta...ils below)

Residents of this encampment are demanding that City officials choice between the following options:

Provide housing or hotel rooms to all residents of this encampment (at least through winter...but then with permanent housing connection)

Open an SOS site in the area immediately where all residents of this encampment can stay

Let former residents of this encampment be (without sweeps and police) wherever reasonable spots they move to

Email mayorsoffice@denvergov.org and join the residents in making these demands!

Moving Support Needed

Please come to 25th and Arapahoe and Lawrence on Tuesday morning to help residents who are moving. Bring any or all of the following:

-Truck, or any vehicle to help move

-Carts

-Bungee Cords

-Rope

-Trash Bags

-Food

-Coffee/CoCo

-Water

Your assistance is much appreciated! Somewhere around 7am and all morning help will likely be needed.

See More

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeThe Colorado law also redefines the characteristics of discrimination to include “hairtexture, hairtype, or...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeThe Colorado law also redefines the characteristics of discrimination to include “hairtexture, hairtype, or a protective hairstyle that is commonly or historically associated with race."

coloradosun.com

Colorado’s hair discrimination law — the CROWN Act — goes into effect

The Colorado law also redefines the characteristics of discrimination to include “hairtexture, hairtype, or a protective hairstyle that is commonly or historically associated with race."The Colorado law also redefines the characteristics of discrimination to include “hairtexture, hairtype, or a protective hairstyle that is commonly or historically associated with race."

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeAccording to data reported to the CDC, 121 children died from COVID-19 between February and July of this...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeAccording to data reported to the CDC, 121 children died from COVID-19 between February and July of this year. And 78% of the children who died were Hispanic, Black or Native American.

npr.org

The Majority Of Children Who Die From COVID-19 Are Children Of Color

According to data reported to the CDC, 121 children died from COVID-19 between February and July of this year. And 78% of the children who died were Hispanic, Black or Native American.According to data reported to the CDC, 121 children died from COVID-19 between February and July of this year. And 78% of the children who died were Hispanic, Black or Native American.

item.title: Apply for additional food aid by Sept 23.
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social Justice

Apply for additional food aid by Sept 23.

The families of more than 200,000 Colorado children have until Sept. 23 to apply for Pandemic EBT benefits of $279 per child.

co.chalkbeat.org

Colorado families are leaving $58 million in federal food aid on the table. Time is running out to apply.

The families of more than 200,000 Colorado children have until Sept. 23 to apply for Pandemic EBT benefits of $279 per child.The families of more than 200,000 Colorado children have until Sept. 23 to apply for Pandemic EBT benefits of $279 per child.
